original_solution_mapping.L1: She puts on 5 products that take 5 minutes each so it takes her 5*5 = <<5*5=25>>25 minutes
original_solution_mapping.L2: It takes 25 minutes to put the products on and an additional 30 minutes for her make-up so all total it takes her 25+30 = <<25+30=55>>55 minutes

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5436.
    Returns: the total time it takes to put on her full face.
    """
    # L1
    num_facial_products = 5 # 5 facial products
    minutes_per_product_application = 5 # waits 5 minutes between each product
    time_for_products = num_facial_products * minutes_per_product_application

    # L2
    additional_makeup_time = 30 # an additional 30 minutes putting on her make-up
    total_time = time_for_products + additional_makeup_time

    # FA
    answer = total_time
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: She puts on {num_facial_products} products that take {minutes_per_product_application} minutes each so it takes her {num_facial_products}*{minutes_per_product_application} = <<{num_facial_products}*{minutes_per_product_application}={time_for_products}>>{time_for_products} minutes

It takes {time_for_products} minutes to put the products on and an additional {additional_makeup_time} minutes for her make-up so all total it takes her {time_for_products}+{additional_makeup_time} = <<{time_for_products}+{additional_makeup_time}={total_time}>>{total_time} minutes

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: She puts on 5 products that take 5 minutes each so it takes her 5*5 = <<5*5=25>>25 minutes
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: It takes 25 minutes to put the products on and an additional 30 minutes for her make-up so all total it takes her 25+30 = <<25+30=750>>750 minutes

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '+' but used '*' instead.
